intro: Horkelia daucifolia subsp. typica, commonly known as the slender horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open, sunny habitats. It is often found in alpine and arid regions, showcasing adaptations to harsh environmental conditions. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native range.
